<abstract>
<para>Before jumping directly into the development tasks, you need to learn about the basic knowledge of eXo Platform 3.5 via the following sections:</para>
<itemizedlist>
  <listitem>
	<para>
	  <emphasis role="bold"><link linkend="DEV.Glossary">Glossary</link></emphasis>
	</para>
	<para>
	Technical terms which are used throughout the documentation.
	</para>
  </listitem>
  <listitem>
	<para>
	  <emphasis role="bold"><link linkend="DEV.SetupMavenSettings">Set up Maven settings</link></emphasis>
	</para>
	 <para>
	  Requirements and how to install a Maven project.
	 </para>
  </listitem>
  <listitem>
	<para>
	  <emphasis role="bold"><link linkend="DEV.eXoArchitecturePremer">eXo Architecture Primer</link></emphasis>
	</para>
	<para>
	Introduction to the eXo architecture, including:
	</para>
  <itemizedlist>
  <listitem>
   <para><emphasis role="bold"><link linkend="DEV.eXoArchitecturePremer.Kernel">Kernel</link></emphasis>
   </para>
   <para>Concepts of containers, services, plugins and configuration loading sequence.</para>
  </listitem>
  <listitem>
	<para>
	  <emphasis role="bold"><link linkend="DEV.eXoArchitecturePremer.GateInExtensions">GateIn extensions</link></emphasis>
	</para>
	<para>
	The special <emphasis>.war</emphasis> files that are recognized by eXo Platform and contribute to custom configurations to the PortalContainer. 
	</para>
  </listitem>
    <listitem>
	<para>
	  <emphasis role="bold"><link linkend="DEV.eXoArchitecturePremer.JavaContentRepository">Java Content Repository</link></emphasis>
	</para>
	<para>
	A Java Content Repository (JCR) where all data of eXo Platform are stored.
	</para>
  </listitem>
 </itemizedlist>
  </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
</abstract>
